dict.string: Use this workflow to manage your hosts file

on alfred_script(q) set hostsFile to "/private/etc/hosts"
try if q is equal to "" then return "Error: No input received" end if
set cmdArray to my split(q, " ") set entryCommand to first item of cmdArray
if entryCommand is equal to "add" then if count of cmdArray is greater than or equal to 3 then set entryIp to second item of cmdArray set entryHost to third item of cmdArray set hostItem to entryIp & " " & entryHost set shellCmd to "echo " & hostItem & " >> " & hostsFile do shell script shellCmd with administrator privileges return "added," & hostItem else return "Error: You need to specify both IP address and host name" end if else set hostItem to do shell script "sed -n '" & q & "p' " & hostsFile return "copied," & hostItem end if
on error errMsg number errNo return "Error: " & errMsg end try
end alfred_script
to split(someText, delimiter) set AppleScript's text item delimiters to delimiter set someText to someText's text items set AppleScript's text item delimiters to {""} return someText end split

on alfred_script(q) set hostsFile to "/private/etc/hosts"
try if q is equal to "" then return "Error: No input received" end if
set hostItem to do shell script "sed -n '" & q & "p' " & hostsFile
if hostItem begins with "#" then set shellCmd to "sed -i\".bak\" '" & q & "s/^#//' " & hostsFile else set shellCmd to "sed -i\".bak\" '" & q & "s/^/#&/' " & hostsFile end if do shell script shellCmd with administrator privileges return "Toggled hosts entry"
on error errMsg number errNo return "Error: " & errMsg end try
return "Error: Command not supported!" end alfred_script

on alfred_script(q) set hostsFile to "/private/etc/hosts"
try if q is equal to "" then return "Error: No input received" end if
set hostItem to do shell script "sed -n '" & q & "p' " & hostsFile
set shellCmd to "sed -i\".bak\" '" & q & "d' " & hostsFile do shell script shellCmd with administrator privileges return hostItem
on error errMsg number errNo return "Error: " & errMsg end try

Manage your hosts file with simple actions to add, remove or toggle entries.
To remove an entry, simply just use the modifier (default: ctrl) when clicking on an entry.
To toggle an entry, simply just use the modifier (default: cmd) when clicking on an entry.
